intro: Prismatocarpus altiflorus, commonly known as the high-flowered prism tree, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and compound leaves with opposite arrangement. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in axillary or terminal inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds, aiding in wind dispersal.
